channel.title: This is confusing!
channel.description: ok so if a .bat (batch) is a command script but .vbs (visual Basic script) is tecnicly just an uncompiled vb file but is that a script? and then isn't batch a script because you could wite the same thing in c++ but a vbs is a script but batch isnt called a script... (im confused?)

item.title: This is confusing!
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Your command of the English language is astounding

VBScript is not “uncompiled VB”, it’s a scripting language that looks similar to VB.
Batch files are a type of script really, I guess the only reason nobody calls it a scripting language is because it’s actually just passing each line to cmd.exe, there is no separate interpreter or anything.

Read full topic
